action.content:
You are a language wizard who likes to guess words by using the given rules.

Welcome to Wordle! You have six attempts to guess the target word, a valid English word of five lowercase letters (a-z). Please use the tags "explanation:" and "guess:" to provide a concise explanation for each guess.

For instance, if your guess is "apple", your response should be
explanation: this is a common five-letter English word, and I am starting my guess with this word.
guess: apple

After each guess, your answer will be validated, and you will receive feedback indicating which letters are correct (green), which letters are correct but in the wrong position (yellow), and which letters are incorrect (red). This feedback can be useful in determining which letters to include or exclude in your next guess.

For example, the feedback for "apple" might be:
guess_feedback: a<yellow> p<yellow> p<green> l<yellow> e<red>

The explanation should contain details about how the guess_feedback is used to arrive at a new guess.

Do not generate any other text.

Let's begin with your first guess.

explanation: I will start with the word "audio" as it contains a mix of common consonants and vowels.
guess: audio

attempts = 1
target_word = intro
guess = audio
guess_feedback = a<red> u<red> d<red> i<yellow> o<green>

guess_feedback: a<red> u<red> d<red> i<yellow> o<green>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: Since "o" is green, it is in the correct position. "i" is yellow, so it is in the word but not in the correct position. "a", "u", and "d" are not in the word. I will guess "opoly" to test if "i" could be in the first position and to check for other common letters.
guess: opoly
Guesser Error: NOT_VALID_WORD_FOR_GAME while parsing Player 1's (model: mistral-large-2411) response

Your guess is not a valid word for this game. Please try again.

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: Since my previous guess was invalid, I will guess "opera" to test if "i" could be in the first position and to check for other common letters like "p", "e", and "r".
guess: opera

attempts = 2
target_word = intro
guess = opera
guess_feedback = o<yellow> p<red> e<red> r<green> a<red>

guess_feedback: o<yellow> p<red> e<red> r<green> a<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: "r" is green, so it is in the correct position. "o" is yellow, so it is in the word but not in the correct position. "p", "e", and "a" are not in the word. I will guess "robot" to test for common letters and place "o" in a different position.
guess: robot

attempts = 3
target_word = intro
guess = robot
guess_feedback = r<yellow> o<yellow> b<red> o<red> t<yellow>

guess_feedback: r<yellow> o<yellow> b<red> o<red> t<yellow>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: "r", "o", and "t" are yellow, so they are in the word but not in the correct position. "b" is not in the word. I will guess "trove" to test new positions for "r", "o", and "t" and to check for other common letters.
guess: trove

attempts = 4
target_word = intro
guess = trove
guess_feedback = t<yellow> r<yellow> o<yellow> v<red> e<red>

guess_feedback: t<yellow> r<yellow> o<yellow> v<red> e<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: "t", "r", and "o" are still yellow, so they are in the word but not in the correct position. "v" and "e" are not in the word. I will guess "ortsy" to test new positions for "o", "r", and "t".
guess: ortsy
Guesser Error: NOT_VALID_WORD_FOR_GAME while parsing Player 1's (model: mistral-large-2411) response

Your guess is not a valid word for this game. Please try again.

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: I will guess "torta" to test new positions for "t", "r", and "o" and to check for the letter "a".
guess: torta

attempts = 5
target_word = intro
guess = torta
guess_feedback = t<yellow> o<yellow> r<yellow> t<red> a<red>

guess_feedback: t<yellow> o<yellow> r<yellow> t<red> a<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: "t", "o", and "r" are still yellow. I will guess "torso" to test "t" and "o" in new positions and to check if "s" is in the word.
guess: torso

attempts = 6
target_word = intro
guess = torso
guess_feedback = t<yellow> o<red> r<yellow> s<red> o<green>
game_result = LOSS

guess_explanation: I will start with the word "audio" as it contains a mix of common consonants and vowels.
Since my previous guess was invalid, I will guess "opera" to test if "i" could be in the first position and to check for other common letters like "p", "e", and "r".

"r" is green, so it is in the correct position. "o" is yellow, so it is in the word but not in the correct position. "p", "e", and "a" are not in the word. I will guess "robot" to test for common letters and place "o" in a different position.

"r", "o", and "t" are yellow, so they are in the word but not in the correct position. "b" is not in the word. I will guess "trove" to test new positions for "r", "o", and "t" and to check for other common letters.
I will guess "torta" to test new positions for "t", "r", and "o" and to check for the letter "a".
"t", "o", and "r" are still yellow. I will guess "torso" to test "t" and "o" in new positions and to check if "s" is in the word.
